interests.description: I always wanted to be a paleontologist and though I ended up in IT they continue to fascinate me, I even built my own "Dinosaur Of The Day" twitter bot (@dinosauria_bot). Just don't mention Jurassic Park.
My first steps in programing involved a copy of David H, Ahl's "BASIC Computer Games" (I still have it) and a teletype attached to a PDP-11/70 and now we have 4K screens and VR.
I love reading about history, from Ancient Egypt and the Romans to the Medieval Ages, the English Civil War through to the Georgian era and the start of the industrial revolution.
Nothing more fun than fiddling with a Raspberry Pi, a soldering iron and some LEDs or trying to make a tensegrity structure. I have so far resisted the temptations of a 3D printer.
Space is big. You just won't believe how vastly, hugely, mind-bogglingly big it is. I mean, you may think it's a long way down the road to the chemist's, but that's just peanuts to space‚Äù.
